ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much from this class. We covered story, character, scene, development, the whole nine yards. We also talked a good amount about the steps of the screenwriting process itself and screenwriting as a career. It was an amazing class.
I learned the key plot features of a screenplay and how the industry works.
I learned all about the industry and what is important to have in a screenplay in order for it to be taken seriously.
I learned the basics of how to develop, write, workshop, and revise a screenplay.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are so many strengths of this class; the professor, the assignments, the experience you gain. I think a large weakness of this class is that it only meets once a week. It makes it harder to engage with the class.
This course is structured well. Being told what to discuss more often at our workshop groups would have helped.
This course would be even better if it were a year long. Just as I felt as though my writing was improved, the semester ended.
more than once a week because a 2 hour class of just sitting keeps engagement challenging

Professor Price is a really fun and engaging teacher, and he did a great job of structuring the class to teach us each step of writing and revising a screenplay. He clearly cares a lot about his students and the material he teaches. 

I didn't find the workshop group meetings outside of class particularly useful or helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would 100% recommend this course to another student. The best way to learn about screenwriting is to write scripts, and that's what you do in this class.
I totally would, because no matter where you are in your writing journey the feedback you get from peers in this class is super helpful.
Yes! It really helped me gain more confidence and technical skills as a writer.
if they want to be a better writer or learn how to write a screenplay, yes
If you want to learn how to write a screenplay, take this class! A fairly deep knowledge of and interest in film is helpful for this class.
